Message.Title: As a reminder, Ex-date is Monday, July 8th
Message.Msg: Must own T at the close tomorrow (Friday, July 5th) to qualify to receive the dividend.

...“We only posted…” – “We”, jon?...ah, yes, jon and winholder, united in a nescient state of cluelessness…I rest my case. And by the way, attempting to combine “our U.S. Constitution” with your “biblical upbringing” only further reveals your complete lack of understanding of both. And, jon, please…stop embarrassing yourself and learn how to spell, Doofus. There are at least six mis-spellings in your mindless rant, Goober. Not to mention that your childish bluster of calling me (or the President) a “supporter of the brotha-hood & Sharia Law” makes you look like some mindless kid crying on a playground, with nothing to back it up. Regarding the fake Marine comment, I was just at Parris Island last Saturday. Would you like to wager, say, whatever you’re worth (just thinking that this concept worked so well for your last candidate in his debate), with the loser donating the “all in” bet to charity? If you’re worth at least 100 grand (which I seriously doubt – your puppy and the trailer aren’t worth that much), I’ll reveal my true identity and never post here again, as long as your money goes to charity. USMC – 64 to 67 – 0351, rockets. Platoon 387 at Parris Island, Sept. ’64. Vietnam, 65-66, E/2/1. Put up or shut up – or do what you normally do… respond with another alias, you cowardly phony.

Message.Title: “one of the prettiest sounds on Earth at sunset.”
Message.Msg: In February of 2008 our "dear leader" told us that the Muslim call to prayer was “one of the prettiest sounds on Earth at sunset.” During the first "Arab Spring" our "dear leader" showed us the correct way to overthrow corrupt and tyrannical governments through his policy of leading from behind, and the MSM (ABC, NBC, CBS, PBS, etc.) covered every second of those heroic acts by freedom loving people. Now that our Muslim brothers have had an opportunity to live under the heals of the boots of dictators sanctioned by our "dear leader" and his minions, and a new "Arab Spring" is being spawned in places like Tahrir Square, the focus of the MSM appears to have wondered to more important topics like the latest revelations from the hit show "Big Brother" or the lack of DNA on this or that object in the George Zimmerman trial. Hey the MSM could have a point; they covered the first "Arab Spring" 24/7, what could be so different about the second one? Move on nothing to report here. Yes my friends I am sure that it will be a long time before you will get to see the visuals or hear interviews from freedom loving folks who are participating in this new "Arab Spring". Further, I believe it will be a long time coming before the MSM reports on the average Egyptian citizen's feelings regarding our "dear leader" and his ambassador Ms. Paterson. Yes our "dear leader" was right, the Muslim call to prayer is “one of the prettiest sounds on Earth at sunset.” "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg

Topic.Title: “one of the prettiest sounds on Earth at sunset.”

Message.Msg: ...“…our ‘dear leader’ told us that the Muslim call to prayer was ‘one of the prettiest sounds on Earth at sunset.’ – frog boy Froggie – are you seriously trying to pass along Rush Limbaugh’s interpretation of Nicholas Kristof’s article? If so, why don’t you say what the article actually said, and not Limbaugh’s goofy attempt to turn it into something else…you are such a tool of the right, unwittingly or not (although you’ve proven consistently to be an intentional liar.) Obama: Man of the World New York Times, by Nicholas Kristof (‘07, btw) “The conventional wisdom about Barack Obama is that he’s smart and charismatic but so inexperienced that we should feel jittery about him in the Oval Office. But that view is myopic. In some respects, Mr. Obama is far more experienced than other presidential candidates.” (Note, frogboy – “myopic” – that describes you to a T.)… “…In foreign policy as well, Mr. Obama would bring to the White House an important experience that most other candidates lack: he has actually lived abroad. He spent four years as a child in Indonesia and attended schools in the Indonesian language… Mr. Obama recalled the opening lines of the Arabic call to prayer, reciting them with a first-rate accent. In a remark that seemed delightfully uncalculated…it’ll give Alabama voters heart attacks…”(folks like frog boy), “Mr. Obama described the call to prayer as ‘one of the prettiest sounds on Earth at sunset’… …Our biggest mistake since World War II has been a lack of sensitivity to other people’s nationalism, from Vietnam to Iraq. Perhaps as a result of his background, Mr. Obama has been unusually sensitive to such issues and to the need to project respect rather than arrogance. He has consistently shown great instincts. So, granted, Mr. Obama lacks the extensive experience at top levels of diplomacy of, say, V. P. Cheney or ... oh, never mind. What sets Mr. Obama apart is the way his training has been at the grass-roots rather than in the treetops. And that may be the richest kind of background of all, yielding not just experience, but also wisdom.” Once again, froggie, your sordid interpretation of events proves exactly what the article says…you clowns are arrogant, insensitive and try repeatedly to intentionally deceive the public because you have nothing else of value to contribute. “…or do what you normally do… respond with another alias, you cowardly phony.” – echo2165 And, frogboy, “In your heart you know he’s right.”

Topic.Title: “one of the prettiest sounds on Earth at sunset.”

Message.Msg: Poor eggo ... you are quoting an article of praise from 2007(??) .. well how is that working for us now (in 2013) - along with the rest of the world's (No-Bama) opinion... Where on earth have you been since 2007 ?? If you would remove your nose from your D.C. parking spot you might be able to go your local garden ctr. and smell what a 'real rose' is like !! I stand by my earlier post .. "Obama only knows what his teleprompter tells him" (unquote) .. but then raises his finger to see if the wind was blowing in the right direction. If not, it was someone elses fault !!

Topic.Title: “one of the prettiest sounds on Earth at sunset.”

Message.Msg: If you're interested in the actual event then I suggest you change the channel. The events in Egypt are being covered extensively on PBS, NPR, the BBC and plenty of other news sources. If you're interested in the life cycle of a news story, there are plenty of sources out there. If you're interested in pushing some sort of Obama/media conspiracy story or trying to (yet again) push the idea that Obama is somehow controlling things in Egypt or that the internal politics of Egypt are somehow reflective of some Obama failure to install the Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt, then you are simply uninteresting.
Oh! How could it be? The Egyptians don't like Obama's hand picked stooge to rule them? Oh! What's the world coming to?

Hey Zippy, I never said he wanted to initiate Sharia Law, I just said the likes it. He was raised part of his life in a Muslim environment. He has never denounced it as a general comment, but then again he doesn't want to irritate his Muslim buddies. I wonder if he will call this latest confusion in Egypt, the Arab Summer?

Yes indeed, if you want a liberal slanted version of the truth, or only half the truth, excluding the part that might hurt Obama's legacy or reputation. Yes indeed, let's all watch the comic version of the news.

Topic.Title: “one of the prettiest sounds on Earth at sunset.”

Message.Msg: "He spent four years as a child in Indonesia and attended schools in the Indonesian language" Yes he did. But that was when he was very young. Lately he can't seem to find out about much of anything unless he hears it on the news. Talk about inexperience shinning through brightly!

Topic.Title: What`s so important about Snowden? Nothing?

Message.Msg: What pray tell does most of your response have to do with the chance that much of the stuff on his laptop or on thumb drives might contain a lot more than stories of the NSA listening to too many phone calls? It has been reported that he left the country with much more top secret information and is willing to share, especially if it keep him from being sent home. I could care less about our illustrious State Department rules and regulations; heck they don't even follow them.

Topic.Title: What`s so important about Snowden? Nothing?

Message.Msg: Just another in a long series of questions that this administration won't address.

Topic.Title: “one of the prettiest sounds on Earth at sunset.”

Message.Msg: Well 'icky' .. Obama is just an opportunist. He'll try to take (undue) credit where he can .. then distance himself from the wrong outcome !! You're free to try to deflect 'froggnot's post in a different direction if you wish, but perhaps some see another point to his message. Obama's mindset is just as revealed by what he does 'not' say, as well as his 'teleprompter' speak !! You may obtain most of your news from CNBC if you wish, and I've already posted the PBS 3, which is my one of my 'OTA' (antenna) station, which airs a variety of english speaking foreign stations .. with in-depth point / counter point discussions LIVE in the Square ... not just selective "sound-bytes" !! Where as our MSM does selective snip-it's .. then quickly moves on to 'Zimmerman nose-picking' .. to deflect from LIVE World changing events !! My reading of his post = in 2008 (a failed Arab Spring) - Obama's boasting of his study of the Koran, seemed to open an uncertain door in Egypt, which I honestly understand. It is a Muslim country - Obama tauts his Muslim education, his name is self-evident !! HOWEVER, he overplayed his rhetoric .. thus opening the doors to a difficult unclear interpretation, depending on the group doing the interpreting !! Morsi made pre-election promises, like Obama .. and again like Obama, failed to live up to these promises ,, with several Supreme Court TESTS on our Constitution !! BUT unlike Obama, Morsi blatantly struck down portions of the Egyptian Constitution which would leave him as THE SURPREME POWER, so he would be able to change things as the 'Brotha-hood' saw fit !! The Saudi Heads of State were the first to openly welcome this Egyptian Revolt , as reported by Algeezera .. R.T (Russia) .. France 24 & others .. most was blacked out in Egypt (betcha our MSM didn't report THAT) Also (now) Snowden is holding the 2nd. spot, with R.T. just reporting "who the HELL does Obama think he is ??" (@ 1:46 EST.) - ha ha ha !!

Topic.Title: What`s so important about Snowden? Nothing?

Message.Msg: .. Kazakh T.V., Kazakhstan Ru. @ 2:02 pm est .. more ruskie news (just started) PBS 3 (ota)

"I just said the likes it. " How utterly dumb. Do you know anything about either Sharia Law or how Obama has lived his life? How can you even compare the two and come to the conclusion that Obama "likes" sharia law? Do you think?

Message.Title: Happy Independance Day everyone
Message.Msg: Based upon the latest Gallup Poll (July 1 through July 4, 2013), I am 93% sure that if you are a Republican you are "Extremely/Very" Proud that you are an American. Further, based upon the same poll, I am 89% sure that if you are a Conservative you are "Extremely/Very" Proud that you are an American. Nice to know that there are still some people left in this country who recognize the value of what a few good men accomplished during the month of July in 1776, and that that spirit is still alive in this great country. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg

...So, Frog Boy, how nice of you to comment on the state of our union! The poll was taken just this week, and you state that 93% of Republicans and 89% of Conservatives are “Extremely/Very Proud” to be an American. Well, there ya’ go…obviously the administration in power is doing a lot to make everyone happy. Gee, it’s pretty bizarre then, that all you do is complain about how horrible things are. Why is that, do you suppose, if all you folks are extremely proud to be an American? Of course the Liberal and Democrats weren’t very far behind in those categories either (76 and 81 percent) and they both had more Moderately Proud than either of your groups. But your silly point, as usual, was to suggest you have the monopoly on patriotism…which is as bogus as most of your other points. And, of course, as proud as you are, the rest of that Gallup Poll, which you conveniently left out, also points out the following: When asked if they believed that the signers of the Declaration of Independence would be pleased of disappointed at how the United States has turned out, quite a different story was told: Pleased – Conservatives: only 15% Republicans: only 12% …… Liberals: 41% Dems:42% Disappointed – Conservatives: 83% Republicans: 86% ….. Liberals: 54% Dems:56& Gee, froggie, for being so proud, you sure are one unhappy lot. You also should look at the moderates in these numbers, but moderation is not in your vocabulary. So, let’s recap. This week over three quarters of all Americans say they are extremely proud or very proud to be an American. I’m glad you pointed that out. Do you know what the numbers from the same poll were back in 2001 were (total)? Who was governing then? Probably not, or you wouldn’t have brought it up. Extremely proud: 55% Very proud: 32% In your heart you know you really need to be more honest with people, Gremlin. Happy Fourth to you and yours.
Yeah, but is Michelle proud to be an American yet?
Do you know? Sorry about the typo, it has been a busy day. You don't know anymore about Obama and what he thinks that what the MSM tells and that is only what he wants them to tell you.

Message.Title: Never Bully ... like in You're Chicago !!
Message.Msg: OH my .. hey 'el presidente' ... so much for your "DETENTE' experience !! NEVER try to bully the Russian that has you by your " two BIG GREEN balls" !! YEP, numerous reports out, about American intimidation, from our "high-level officials" .. towards our other allies .. as a tactic to force them to blackball the Rusky's over Snowden ?? ..... I doubt that you'll hear about this in OUR MSM .... OH, Putin doesn't like that tactic !! AND with those "two BIG GREEN balls" he's holding - Putin has COMPLETE CONTROL of a skinny little "green" yapping teleprompter Whaaaat ... too many past lies to Putin too ?? . [O's accidental open mic whisper to Putin] .."I'll have a little more flexibility AFTER I'm re-elected" !! THOSE "two big green balls" (besides the laptops) ..... are a certain 'drop-dead gorgeous lady' with lots of assets & charm, and a Russian citizen, wants to marry Snowden !! YEP, some of us may remember her (??) as that red-headed beauty that used to live in the U.S ... the one that fooled our CIA for years .. the Russian 'spy', Anna Chapman !! Dang. I hope i'm invited to the wedding ??
Thanks frogg .. and to you too !! AND as as they said back prior to the war ... keep your powder dry boys .. (smiles)

Yes, and the other 7% are like you, gathered from all your complaining about our country. President Obama is 100% proud of America. Duly electing their President, proud Americans follow democracy and support their President, regardless if the election went their way. Whatever poll you see about Republicans loving America, add 5% to the value for Democrats, who understand America is for all, not some. It's so right wing nut job to think they are the patriotic ones, but in fact they seem to be interested only in politics, not the country.
What an incredible piece of BS you were fed!
Not since her husband invented the crotch salute!

Well! Well! Well! It is becoming more and more obvious that you are not reading your own posts. Thanks for the laugh echo, and again happy Independence Day. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg
